title: Fed to announce next moves on rates
text:
DENVER, CO - OCTOBER 8: Fed Chairman Jerome Powell is giving a luncheon keynote at the National Association of Business Economists in Embassy Suites by Hilton Denver Downtown Convention Center. October 08, 2019. (Photo by Hyoung Chang/MediaNews Group/The Denver Post via Getty Images)

Markets will be tuned into the Federal Reserve’s announcement on Wednesday afternoon to see if the central bank delivers on a much anticipated third rate cut of the year.

As of Tuesday night, federal funds futures markets were pricing in a 97.8% chance of the Fed cutting by 25 basis points at the conclusion of its meeting Oct. 30.

But the key question is whether the Fed Chairman Jerome Powell will telegraph more rate cuts in the near future. Some Wall Street analysts have speculated the Fed could stop after a rate cut on Wednesday, since three rate cuts were the magic number for the Fed’s effort to stave off a recession in 1995-1996.

Things worth watching: commentary from Powell on the Fed’s decision in mid-October to resume organic balance sheet growth, in addition to whether there will be dissents. In the Fed’s last meeting, Powell faced three dissents, the largest divergence in policy suggestions since Powell became Fed chair in 2018.

The Fed’s policy decision will be announced at 2 p.m. ET on Wednesday and will not come with a new round of economic projections. Powell’s press conference will begin at 2:30 p.m. ET.

Brian Cheung is a reporter covering the banking industry and the intersection of finance and policy for Yahoo Finance. You can follow him on Twitter @bcheungz.

description: The Federal Reserve is poised to cut rate for the third consecutive time at the conclusion of its October FOMC meeting on Wednesday afternoon.
